intro: Epidendrum nocturnum var. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf night orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its dark green, narrow leaves and produces striking white to pale lavender flowers that bloom at night. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical rainforests. It thrives in humid, shaded environments with high air circulation. Its nocturnal blooming habit makes it a unique and sought-after specimen among orchid enthusiasts.
